text:
OK, this I have running now
then, this <https://github.com/HubSpot/local-cms-server-cli> is not an official HubSpot hubl server?
You should use template annotations locally to set that value <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/local-development-reference>
`isAvailableForNewContent: true`
OH! that’s awesome, thank you! I missed that on that page
By the way we are planning on documenting that endpoint soon to be used by API developers

Oh nice! To be honest, I’m putting together a bit of a toolchain for my team and I’m just importing things from `@HubSpot/cms-lib` directly. which I know isn’t how you intended it to be used, but it works :slightly_smiling_face:
Has anyone used Prettier to format files with Hubl in them? We're trying to use Husky to format files on commit, but we're having some trouble with it parsing the hubl.
I have… it’s not very pretty
I was running prettier on save in VSCODE, but as you said, it doesn’t play nice with Hubl at all, so unfortunately, I had to abandon it
Damn... we got it pretty close, but it's erroring in, for instance, situations where there's and if statement that determines an opening tag, so it sees 3 opening tags and only 1 closing tag.
Ah.  That’s a bummer
Yes... well thanks for sharing!
fwiw, <https://github.com/prettier/prettier/issues/5754> and <https://github.com/justrhysism/prettier-plugin-nunjucks> are some steps on the path
Ah! good call... I'll pass these along and see if this can work for us. Thank you <@U22VBL87M>!

<https://github.com/trivago/prettier-plugin-twig-melody> is one for twig but also features the same style syntax as hubl. it's worked for me in my local editor. maybe you can get it to work in your commits as well
Oh, excellent, we'll check that out as well. Thanks <@U7V9DQ31P>!
So, I’ve got a pretty funny use case for HubSpot local development
If you’re ever locked out of your account due to non-payment, rest assured, you can still edit templates and modules with the CLI
(bill has now been paid, but it was very nice to not lose an entire morning of work)
that project isn't being actively worked on/maintained at the moment
